Alerta por lluvias, tormentas y actividad eléctrica para Catamarca

02 Nov 2019, 10:32

El Servicio Meteorológico Nacional (SMN) emitió una serie de alertas debido a probabilidad de tormentas y vientos fuertes en varias regiones del país para la jornada de este sábado.  La primera alerta se centra en las zonas centro y este de Catamarca, centro y este de Jujuy, centro y este de Salta, Tucumán, donde se espera que a partir de la tarde de hoy comiencen a generarse lluvias y tormentas, algunas de las cuales podrán ser fuertes y estar acompañadas de fuerte actividad eléctrica, ráfagas, ocasional caída de granizo y principalmente abundante caída de agua en cortos periodos.  Las condiciones, según se informó, tenderán a mejorar durante la madrugada de este domingo.  La siguiente alerta emitida por el SMN es para las zonas centro y oeste de la provincia de Buenos Aires, este de Chubut, Córdoba, La Pampa, Este de La Rioja, Este de Mendoza, Centro y este de Río Negro, Este de San Juan, San Luis, Sur de Santa Fe.  El pasaje de un frente frío a través del área de cobertura provoca un cambio en la dirección de los vientos al sector sur con velocidades estimadas entre 40 y 50 km/h con ráfagas de hasta 80 km/h. Se espera que la intensidad de los mismos comiencen a disminuir a partir de la tarde de hoy.

Police suspicion of suspicion of concealment of defects
02 Nov 2019, 10:09 by Kim Woo-young
2019.11.02 19:09 Kim Hyo-jun, 62, chairman of BMW Korea, who was accused of concealing and reducing the risk of a BMW vehicle fire due to a faulty engine design, was handed over to the prosecution. The Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency's Intelligence Criminal Investigation Division announced on August 2 that eight employees of BMW Korea including Chairman Kim and two subsidiaries including BMW Headquarters and BMW Korea were sent to the prosecution for suspicion of violating the automobile management law.


Kim Hyo-jun, chairman of BMW Korea, was summoned as a suspect to the Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency's Intelligent Crime Investigation Unit last May and headed for the investigation. /yunhap news

According to the police, Chairman Kim and others are accused of concealing and reducing the defects of the engine exhaust recirculation system (EGR) in BMW cars. The police analyzed the data obtained by seizing and searching the headquarters of BMW Korea, the headquarters of the EGR supplier, and the research institute. However, the allegations of Harald Kruger BMW, who were allegedly charged, were not disclosed. The so-called “BMW car fire” started last year with a total of 52 cars. Originally, BMW said, "Because of the driver's negligence in management." "Fire due to a safety check mistake." In December last year, the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism recognized that BMW had concealed and reduced the risk of fire due to manufacturing defects since 2015. The joint findings were released. In addition, even after the recall decision was made in July last year, it was considered that they did not take proper follow-up measures such as excluding fire-hazardous vehicles from the recall. Accordingly, the government decided to accuse BMW Korea for violating the Automobile Management Act and to impose a penalty of KRW11.2 billion on prolonged recall.
